title: Trump’s Second-Term Promises: What He’s Done So Far on Immigration, Trade, DEI and More
summary: President Trump has driven illegal crossings at the border to record lows, helped bring about an uneasy cease-fire in Gaza and upended the global trading system.

title: Kennedy Center Chief Threatens Legal Action Over Canceled Christmas Concert
summary: The musician Chuck Redd called off the annual Christmas Eve performances after the Kennedy Center board added President Trump’s name to the performing arts center.

title: Karoline Leavitt Says She’s Expecting Her Second Child
summary: The White House press secretary announced on Instagram that she was pregnant with a daughter who is due in May. She and her husband have a 1-year-old son.

title: California Drops Lawsuit Over $4 Billion Federal Cut to High-Speed Rail Project
summary: California sued after the Trump administration cut grants for the long-planned project. The state says it will seek private investors instead.

title: Russia Pummels Kyiv Before Trump-Zelensky Meeting
summary: The assault began around 1:30 a.m. local time on Saturday and continued for nearly 10 hours.

title: This Ukrainian Soldier Spent More Than a Year on the Front Line
summary: Serhii Tyschenko, a Ukrainian combat medic, spent 472 days in a bunker. His case appears to be an extreme example of a problem that has long plagued Kyiv’s military.

title: What Went Wrong Before Hong Kong’s Inferno
summary: Records show how government departments played down residents’ warnings about corrupt practices and substandard materials that fueled the deadly blaze.

title: How One Father Created an Organ Empire
summary: The National Kidney Registry has matched thousands of kidney donors with recipients. It has also paid millions of dollars to a company owned by its founder.

title: Park Chan-wook and the Funny Thing About Stomach-Churning Horror
summary: When American studios wouldn’t back his film about a laid-off manager committing gruesome murders, the director returned to Korea. Now he has a hit on his hands.

title: In Which I Try Valiantly to Cheer You Up
summary: OK, 2025 wasn’t the best year ever. But we’re arguably still in the best decade in the history of humanity.

title: Good Calls
summary: This week, we close out the year with your best advice of 2025.

title: New Yorkers Wake Up to Snow, Though Not as Much as Forecast
summary: Predictions were revised down on Friday. Central Park still saw more than 2 inches of snow, with higher totals outside of New York City.

title: Annette Dionne, Last of the Celebrated Quintuplets, Dies at 91
summary: She was the first to crawl, the first to cut a tooth, the first to recognize her name, and the last to die. And, like her sisters, she resented being exploited as part of a global sensation.

title: In Myanmar, the Election Is Called Fake, but the Human Suffering Is Real
summary: A coup set off a brutal civil war and made a poor country poorer. Now its military rulers are seeking a veneer of legitimacy by holding elections.

title: A Wealth Tax Floated in California Has Billionaires Thinking of Leaving
summary: It’s uncertain whether the proposal will reach the statewide ballot in November, but some billionaires like Peter Thiel and Larry Page may be unwilling to take the risk.
